newsitem.title: NORWAY: PGS orders $85 mln vessel from Aker unit.
newsitem.headline: PGS orders $85 mln vessel from Aker unit.

text.p: Norwegian offshore services company Petroleum Geo-Servioces ASA (PGS) said on Friday it had ordered its fifth Ramform seismic survey vessel from Langsten Slip & Baatbyggeri, a partly-owned division of Aker RGI.
The vessel will cost around $85 million and is due to be delivered in the first quarter of 1999.

PGS said it expects to take delivery of the third and fourth Ramform seismic vessels during the first half of 1998. All of the company's Ramform vessels have been constructed on budget and on time at the same Norwegian shipyard, it said.
The company also has an option with Langsten Slip for a six vessel.
"Timing of construction for the sixth vessel will depend on market conditions, but will most likely be before the year 2000," PGS said in a statement.
